Subject area
In order to effectively work with System data, understanding the principles of creating, implementing business processes and user preferences is not enough. It is important to understand what kind of information the System should manage, and therefore, it is necessary to know what logical connections can exist between different objects of the System.
Subject areas are used to form such an understanding. They display the structural elements of the task (entity), their own attribute composition and the relations between the elements (including inheritance relationships that allow us to judge the inherited attributes).
A subject area is a directory of subject areas that contains object types related to a single task.
The purpose of constructing subject areas is to obtain a graphical representation of the logical structure of the subject area under study, i.e. to display the relationships between the objects of the System.

To install the selected product, click the corresponding button, confirm the action in the modal window, and wait for the installation process to complete. After that, the "Installed" label will appear next to the product. Clicking on the product will open the corresponding subject area, available for editing.
The user can read the detailed product description by clicking the "Learn more" button, which will open the product page on the Marketplace.
On the page that opens, specify the name of the subject area in the field located on the control panel.
The default name is New Subject Area.
After that, creating and customizing the subject area is done using the buttons located on the control panel and in the subject area creation area.

More info
The search field can be opened by using the keyboard shortcut Ctrl+F.
The object type is searched by object type name and table name, even if these values were hidden in the subject area via object display settings.
The attribute is searched by attribute name, by field name for the table and by attribute type, even if these values were hidden in the subject area via attribute display settings.
All items matching the search query will be bolded in the subject area, and the table of the found item on which the focus is located will be highlighted in yellow.

Deleting an object type. When clicking the button, the user must choose a deletion method:
Remove object type from the domain - excludes the object type from the domain without deleting it from the System;
Delete object type - permanently deletes the object type from the System with no possibility of recovery.
Permanent deletion of an object is only allowed if the user has the "Run"

Configuring visual settings
In order to correctly configure the subject area, it is necessary to determine what information and in what form it will be displayed on the area. To do this, go to the settings of the subject area by clicking
.
The default settings are as follows:
Object display
In this section, the type of visualization in the subject area can be selected. The user can display the name of the object, its identifier, or both options at the same time.
One of the "Show type name" or "Show table ident" modes must be enabled.
Attribute visual
This setting allows the user to determine what information about the properties (attributes) of an object will be presented in its card. To do this, the configuration of the display of the following elements is required:
Name;
Identifier;
Required;
Attribute type color;
Attribute type.
Relation visual
For a detailed visualization of the relations between objects, the System automatically displays the type of arrow that corresponds to a particular type of relation.
There are 3 types of arrows (of relations between objects) in total:
Designation
Name
Purpose
Inheritance
Link to the parent object
Aggregation relation
Link to the Local object of the main object type
Relation link
Link to the object that is more commonly used as a directory
When right-clicking on an associative relation, the following options are available:
- convert the association relation into an aggregation relation. When clicking the button, a modal window will open for creating a child attribute.
- delete the association relation. When clicking the button, a modal window will open to confirm the relation deletion from the subject area and the removal of the object attribute in the object type.
If the target object type is a system type, these options are unavailable.
In the data visual editing mode, the user can customize the visualization of relations between objects. It is done by:
Allowing (restricting) demonstration of a relation type;
Selecting the type of line.
Export subject area
The customized subject area can be exported for further use in 3 possible formats:
PNG;
JPEG;
PDF.
